bibframe.description:
The BIBFRAME specification is
relative new having started with an announcement by the Library of
Congress in 2011. Since then, a lot of work has gone into developing a
more robust vocabulary along with experimental support implementation by
the Library of Congress, OCLC, and others including Colorado College.
bibframe.label: History of BIBFRAME
bibframe.name: history

bibframe.description: An overview of the major classes and relationships in the BIBFRAME vocabulary
bibframe.label: BIBFRAME Vocabulary Overview
bibframe.name: vocab-overview

bibframe.description:
Creative Work is the base or root
class with specific sub-classes for different types of works. BIBFRAME uses a
class hierarchy with child classes inheriting properties for its parent classes
bibframe.label: Creative Works
bibframe.name: creative-works

bibframe.description:
An Instance is a single item be it a physical
resource or digital object, and includes metadata specific to the object
bibframe.label: Instances
bibframe.name: instances

bibframe.description:
A resource that reflects an authoritative
relationship between the resource and a Work or Instance
bibframe.label: Authorities
bibframe.name: authorities

bibframe.description: An Annotation is additional information about a BIBFRAME Creative Work, Instance, Authority, or another Annotation
bibframe.label: Annotations
bibframe.name: annotations

bibframe.description: While BIBFRAME does not currently have any official mapping to RDA, some information mapping and experimentation has occurred, particularly in the Redis Library Services Platform
bibframe.label: RDA in BIBFRAME
bibframe.name: rda-in-bibframe

bibframe.description: The Redis Library Services Platform is an open-source project that uses BIBFRAME to represent bibliographic entities with BIBFRAME, MARC21, RDA and Schema.org properties
bibframe.label: BIBFRAME and the Redis Library Services Platform
bibframe.name: bibframe-rlsp
